strength.translation[0].definitions[0].d: the physical power and energy that makes someone strong
strength.translation[0].definitions[0].e: I’m trying to build up my strength.
Jo hit him with all her strength.
He never ceased to be amazed by her physical strength.
She didn’t even have the strength to stand up.
have/find the strength to do something
strength.translation[0].definitions[1].d: the quality of being brave or determined in dealing with difficult or unpleasant situations
strength.translation[0].definitions[1].e: She had enormous strength of character  (=strong ability to deal with difficult situations).
I think you have to find an inner strength in order to feel good about yourself.
Jenny didn’t have the strength to end the relationship.
have/find the strength to do something
The sea was very cold and it required great strength of mind to get in.
strength.translation[0].definitions[2].d: how strong a feeling, belief, or relationship is
strength.translation[0].definitions[2].e: We understand the strength of feeling against the proposal.
Governments cannot ignore the strength of public opinion.
strength.translation[0].definitions[3].d: the political, military, or economic power of an organization, country, or system
strength.translation[0].definitions[3].e: The socialists organized a show of strength  (=when a country or organization shows how strong it is).
the strength of the US economy
strength.translation[0].definitions[4].d: a particular quality or ability that gives someone or something an advantage
strength.translation[0].definitions[4].e: Her main strength is her critical thinking ability.
Be aware of your own strengths and weaknesses.
The great strength of our plan lies in its simplicity.
strength.translation[0].definitions[5].d: how strong an object or structure is, especially its ability to last for a long time without breaking
strength.translation[0].definitions[5].e: a device for testing the strength of concrete structures
strength.translation[0].definitions[6].d: how strong a substance or mixture is
strength.translation[0].definitions[6].e: Add water to dilute the solution to the required strength.
Young plants can be fed with half-strength liquid fertilizer.
strength.translation[0].definitions[7].d: the number of people in a team, army etc
strength.translation[0].definitions[7].e: The Edinburgh team are now at full strength.
The police force is below strength at the moment  (=there are fewer police than there should be).
Security forces were out in strength  (=in large numbers) but did not intervene.
strength.translation[0].definitions[8].d: the value of a country’s money when compared to other countries’ money
strength.translation[0].definitions[8].e: the strength of the dollar on the international money markets
strength.translation[0].definitions[9].d: how strong a natural force is
how strong a colour, taste etc is
strength.translation[0].note_box[0].head: – Meaning 1: the physical power and energy that makes someone strong
strength.translation[0].note_box[0].sect: physical strength
Some of the tasks required considerable physical strength.
great/enormous strength
Hercules was famous for his great strength.
superhuman strength
In the movie, Walsh performs feats of superhuman strength.
superior strength
Using his superior strength, Rocky dragged the struggling Larsen another twenty yards back.
brute strength
There is more to wrestling than brute strength. Tactics are important too.
full strength
It takes time to get your full strength back after you have been ill.
have the strength to do something
He didn't even have the strength to sit up.
find the strength to do something
Mary found the strength to climb up onto the upturned boat.
use your strength
He used all his strength to heave the door shut.
gather/muster/summon your strength
He sat for a couple of minutes, gathering his strength.
build up your strength
You need to build up your strength.
gain strength
After the operation, he spent several weeks relaxing and gaining strength.
strength.translation[0].note_box[1].head: – Meaning 2: the quality of being brave or determined in dealing with difficult or unpleasant situations
strength.translation[0].note_box[1].sect: great strength
She showed great strength in dealing with her problems.
inner strength
Geoff had an inner strength which got him through the tough times.
mental strength
He's a player who has the skill and the mental strength to win.
have the strength to do something
This proved that he has the strength to cope with such a high-powered job.
find the strength to do something
Paula had found the strength to escape from an abusive marriage.
gain/draw strength from somebody/something
He gained strength from being back with the people and things he loved.
show strength
The decision to continue shows incredible strength and courage.
strength of character
The victims' families have shown amazing strength of character.
strength of purpose/mind
In pursuing this ambition, William showed remarkable strength of purpose.
a source of strength
Her faith had always been a source of strength for her.
strength.translation[0].note_box[2].head: – Meaning 5: a particular quality or ability that gives someone or something an advantage
strength.translation[0].note_box[2].sect: Diversity is one of India's greatest strengths.
The play's real strength is the way it explores relationships.
The organization must move forward and capitalize on its strengths.
Both parties are playing to their strengths.
The teacher can identify each child's strengths and build on these.
It's important to know your strengths as well as your weaknesses.
The show's strength lies in the fact that it appeals to all ages.
All technologies have different strengths and weaknesses.
strength.translation[1].definitions[0].d: the value of a country’s money, especially when this is at a high level
strength.translation[1].definitions[0].e: the strength of the yen on the international money markets
strength.translation[1].definitions[1].d: the power or influence that a person, organization, country etc has
strength.translation[1].definitions[1].e: the strength of the US economy
Before and during negotiations, a salesperson will benefit by assessing the relative strength of his power base.
strength.translation[1].definitions[2].d: the good qualities or abilities that someone or something has
strength.translation[1].definitions[2].e: One of her management strengths is the ability to delegate.
Judging one’s own strengths and weaknesses is far from easy.
